## How Germany Income Tax Works
The German income tax system is a progressive tax system, meaning that higher income earners are taxed at a higher rate. The tax year in Germany runs from January 1 to December 31. The current income tax rates in Germany range from 14% to 45%, with a basic tax-free allowance of €9,744 for single individuals and €19,488 for married couples.

## How to Use This Calculator
To use this calculator, you need to input your gross income, tax status (single or married), and number of children. The gross income is your total income before taxes, including salary, investments, and any other sources of income. For example, let's say you are a single person with a gross income of €50,000 per year and no children. You would enter these values into the calculator to get an estimate of your net income after taxes.

## Key Germany Income Tax Rules
Some important rules to keep in mind when it comes to income tax in Germany include:
* The **tax-free allowance** of €9,744 for single individuals and €19,488 for married couples.
* The **solidarity surcharge** of 5.5% on top of the income tax, which is used to support the German states.
* The **church tax**, which is 8-9% of the income tax, and is only applicable to members of certain churches.
The filing deadline for income tax returns in Germany is July 31 of the following year. There are also exemptions for certain types of income, such as scholarships and some types of investment income.

## Common Questions
### What is the tax-free allowance in Germany?
The tax-free allowance in Germany is €9,744 for single individuals and €19,488 for married couples.
### How much is the solidarity surcharge in Germany?
The solidarity surcharge in Germany is 5.5% of the income tax.
### Do I have to pay church tax in Germany?
You only have to pay church tax in Germany if you are a member of a certain church, such as the Catholic or Protestant church.
### Can I claim deductions on my income tax return in Germany?
Yes, you can claim deductions on your income tax return in Germany, such as for charitable donations or expenses related to your job.
### What is the deadline for filing my income tax return in Germany?
The deadline for filing your income tax return in Germany is July 31 of the following year.
